meanings.definition: To insure for an amount greater than the actual value or risk.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overinsure her belongings, paying more than necessary for coverage.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to overinsure your car for more than its worth.
meanings.sent3: John accidentally overinsured his phone, thinking it was a priceless artifact.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to overinsure their building to protect against any unforeseen disasters.
meanings.sent5: Overinsuring your house may lead to higher premiums without much benefit.

meanings.sent1: The insurance agent warned against the tendency to overinsure, as it could be a waste of money.
meanings.sent2: Some people overinsure their health, fearing every possible illness.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's cat managed to overinsure itself by getting insured for nine lives.
meanings.sent4: The small business decided to overinsure their equipment to ensure smooth operations.
meanings.sent5: It is better to avoid overinsuring your possessions to save on insurance costs.
